page.title: 14West Newton School
page.content:
The school, a Voluntary Aided Primary School, was built at the same time as the majority of the village, around 1870. It is a typical village school consisting of two rooms, an infant room for 4 to 7 year olds, and a Junior room for the 7 to 11 year olds.
Two teachers teach about thirty children in mixed age and ability classes. Much of the work is individually based and because of this and the close relationship between teacher and pupil, the children transfer to their secondary schools both confident and competent
In addition to the normal school activities, the children go on School Journeys and trips. It is a bright and cheerful place.
